repositories.brief_summary: Compiler hash migration to BLAKE128, thread safety improvements, and FlexDLL build enhancements
repositories.new_features_summary: BLAKE128 hash migration, new C thread domain registration, TSan fixes, and enhanced FlexDLL build configuration
repositories.new_features:
- **BLAKE128 hash migration** for compiler CRCs replacing MD5 across all file formats (cmi, cmo, cmx, cmxs) and consistency checking by [Vincent Laviron](https://github.com/lthls) ([#13913](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13913))
- **New C API function** `caml_c_thread_register_in_domain` for registering C threads in specific OCaml domains by [Jack Joergensen](https://github.com/jacknojo) ([#14275](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14275))
- **TSan fixes** for C calls with many stack arguments affecting ARM64, POWER, RISC-V, s390x, and x86_64 architectures by [Olivier Nicole](https://github.com/OlivierNicole) ([#14255](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14255))
- **FlexDLL build improvements** with new configuration options for MANIFEST_TOOL, RC (resource compiler), and FLEXLINKFLAGS, requiring FlexDLL >= 0.44 by [Antonin Décimo](https://github.com/MisterDA) ([#14034](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14034))
- **Type checker determinism** improvements avoiding hash table iteration for types and terms by [Vincent Laviron](https://github.com/lthls) ([#14297](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14297), [#14299](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14299))
- **Manual updates** including new native debugger chapter covering GDB and LLDB support by [Tim McGilchrist](https://github.com/tmcgilchrist) ([#13747](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13747))
- **Runtime_events.Timestamp documentation** improvements clarifying timestamp precision and behavior by [Raphaël Proust](https://github.com/raphael-proust) ([#14293](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14293))
- **Symbol naming changes** using `$` instead of `.` to separate module from identifiers in symbols by [Tim McGilchrist](https://github.com/tmcgilchrist) ([#13050](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13050))
repositories.activity_summary: Twelve merged PRs and twelve newly opened PRs covering runtime improvements, hash migration, and build system updates
repositories.activity:
- **Twelve new PRs opened** this week including [Hannes Mehnert](https://github.com/hannesm) proposing to make Hashtbl seeded by default ([#14291](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14291)), deprecate Digest top-level bindings ([#14294](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14294)), and preserve option R in runtime parameters ([#14292](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14292)), [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche) addressing runtime memory safety in minor GC ([#14306](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14306)), memprof configuration ([#14304](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14304), [#14305](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14305)), and backup thread synchronization ([#14303](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14303)), [Olivier Nicole](https://github.com/OlivierNicole) fixing TSan shadow stack for POWER ([#14302](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14302)), disabling flaky TSan test ([#14301](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14301)), and improving pipe operator typechecking ([#14286](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14286)), [Antonin Décimo](https://github.com/MisterDA) improving mingw format specifiers ([#14308](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14308)), and [Tim McGilchrist](https://github.com/tmcgilchrist) fixing frame pointer tests ([#14295](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14295))
- **Compiler hash migration** completed with [Vincent Laviron](https://github.com/lthls) merging BLAKE128 implementation affecting all compiler consistency checks and file formats ([#13913](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13913)), followed by determinism improvements ([#14297](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14297), [#14299](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14299))
- **Thread safety improvements** delivered through [Olivier Nicole](https://github.com/OlivierNicole) fixing TSan bugs with multi-argument C calls ([#14255](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14255)) and [Jack Joergensen](https://github.com/jacknojo) adding domain-specific thread registration ([#14275](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14275)) with documentation updates by [Guillaume Munch-Maccagnoni](https://github.com/gadmm) ([#14296](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14296))
- **Build system enhancements** for Windows with [Antonin Décimo](https://github.com/MisterDA) improving FlexDLL build tools selection ([#14034](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14034))
- **Documentation updates** including [Tim McGilchrist](https://github.com/tmcgilchrist) adding native debugger manual chapter ([#13747](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13747)) and [Raphaël Proust](https://github.com/raphael-proust) improving Runtime_events.Timestamp documentation ([#14293](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14293))
- **Additional improvements** including signals work by [Tim McGilchrist](https://github.com/tmcgilchrist) ([#13843](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13843)), symbol naming changes ([#13050](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13050)), and CI typo fix by [Hannes Mehnert](https://github.com/hannesm) ([#14309](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14309))
repositories.discussions_summary: Discussion on introducing one-liner comment syntax continues
repositories.notable_discussions: - **One-liner comment syntax** proposal discussion by [David Wong](https://github.com/mimoo) exploring the addition of single-line comment syntax to OCaml ([#12066](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/12066))
repositories.trends_summary: Focus on thread safety with multiple TSan-related fixes and runtime memory management improvements
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **Runtime memory safety focus** with multiple PRs from [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche) addressing race conditions and memory management in runtime components including minor GC, memprof, and domain termination
- **Thread sanitizer testing** becoming more comprehensive with [Olivier Nicole](https://github.com/OlivierNicole) fixing bugs across multiple architectures and improving test coverage
- **Cryptographic hash migration** from MD5 to BLAKE128 reflecting modern security practices and performance considerations
- **Build toolchain flexibility** improvements for Windows/FlexDLL enabling better compiler selection and cross-platform support
- **Compiler determinism** as a continued focus with hash table iteration being eliminated from type and term generation
repositories.contributors_summary: Active contributions from multiple developers working on compiler internals, thread safety, and build improvements
repositories.contributors:
- [Vincent Laviron](https://github.com/lthls) implemented BLAKE128 hash migration affecting all compiler file formats ([#13913](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13913)) and improved compiler determinism by eliminating hash table iteration ([#14297](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14297), [#14299](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14299))
- [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche) opened multiple runtime safety PRs addressing memory management in minor GC ([#14306](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14306)), memprof configuration ([#14304](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14304), [#14305](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14305)), and backup thread synchronization ([#14303](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14303))
- [Olivier Nicole](https://github.com/OlivierNicole) fixed TSan bugs affecting C calls with many arguments across multiple architectures ([#14255](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14255)) and opened PR for POWER shadow stack accounting ([#14302](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14302))
- [Hannes Mehnert](https://github.com/hannesm) proposed making Hashtbl seeded by default ([#14291](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14291)), deprecating Digest top-level bindings ([#14294](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14294)), and fixed CI typo ([#14309](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14309))
- [Antonin Décimo](https://github.com/MisterDA) improved FlexDLL build tools selection with new configuration options ([#14034](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14034)) and opened PR for mingw format specifier improvements ([#14308](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14308))
- [Tim McGilchrist](https://github.com/tmcgilchrist) added native debugger chapter to manual ([#13747](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13747)), implemented signals work ([#13843](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13843)), and improved symbol naming ([#13050](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13050))
- [Jack Joergensen](https://github.com/jacknojo) added new C API for domain-specific thread registration ([#14275](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14275))
- [Raphaël Proust](https://github.com/raphael-proust) improved Runtime_events.Timestamp documentation ([#14293](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14293))
- [Guillaume Munch-Maccagnoni](https://github.com/gadmm) updated documentation for thread registration constraints ([#14296](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14296))

repositories.brief_summary: Released opam 2.5.0~alpha1 with shell initialization improvements, AppArmor support, and bug fixes across multiple platforms
repositories.new_features_summary: Shell initialization improvements, AppArmor support, recompilation fixes, OPAMFETCH parsing, and git handling enhancements
repositories.new_features:
- **Shell initialization** improvements by [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) including writing to `.bashrc` instead of `.profile` for Bash users during `opam init` ([#6603](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6603), fixing shell hook execution issues), and preventing redundant environment updates when `OPAM_SWITCH_PREFIX` is already set by [David Allsopp](https://github.com/dra27) ([#6729](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6729), addressing path conflicts)
- **AppArmor support** added to the install script by [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) to resolve installation issues on Ubuntu 24.04 and other apparmor-configured systems ([#6647](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6647), fixes [#5968](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/5968))
- **Bug fixes** delivered including fix for erroneous recompilations on packages with empty `build`/`runtest`/`install`/`remove` fields by [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) ([#6505](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6505), fixes [#5814](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/5814)), proper parsing of `OPAMFETCH` with POSIX shell syntax support ([#5492](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/5492), fixes [#5490](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/5490)), and `opam remove --force` no longer executing commands in current directory by [R. Boujbel](https://github.com/rjbou) ([#6672](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6672), fixes [#6570](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6570))
- **Git handling** enhanced with exit code 2 support for `git remote get-url` retrieval by [R. Boujbel](https://github.com/rjbou), improving error messages in `opam lock` for pinned packages ([#6422](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6422))
- **Alpine Linux support** hardened with improved parsing of `apk policy` output by [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) ([#6742](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6742))
- **Repository administration** improvements by [R. Boujbel](https://github.com/rjbou) enforcing repository root checks for all `opam admin` commands and adding upgrade advice for version 1.2 repositories ([#6391](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6391))
- **Release infrastructure** improvements including reproducible release archives by [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) ([#6706](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6706), fixes [#6619](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6619)) and Windows bootstrap dependencies updated to FlexDLL 0.44 and msvs-detect 0.7.0 by [Antonin Décimo](https://github.com/MisterDA) ([#6592](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6592))
- **Testing infrastructure** enhancements with new `opam-set-os` command for cleaner reftest OS family configuration by [@arozovyk](https://github.com/arozovyk) ([#6741](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6741)) and `sed-hash` command for replacing hashes in opam outputs by [R. Boujbel](https://github.com/rjbou) ([#6734](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6734))
repositories.activity_summary: Released 2.5.0~alpha1, opened six new PRs for future work, optimized CI, and addressed Windows bootstrap challenges
repositories.activity:
- **Six new PRs opened** this week representing future development work: removal of unused admin scripts by [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) ([#6750](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6750)), cleanup of stale switch directories by [@arozovyk](https://github.com/arozovyk) ([#6735](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6735)), hardening of Makefile inline shell scripts ([#6751](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6751)), and post-release follow-up work including version bumps and installer updates ([#6747](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6747), [#6748](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6748))
- **Release 2.5.0~alpha1** delivered by [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) and [R. Boujbel](https://github.com/rjbou) with comprehensive changelog covering incremental opam file loading, shell initialization improvements, AppArmor support, and numerous bug fixes ([#6744](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6744) with extensive review discussion)
- **Windows bootstrap dependency revert** under discussion by [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) and [Antonin Décimo](https://github.com/MisterDA) due to FlexDLL version parsing issues affecting the build process ([#6746](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6746))
- **CI optimization** implemented by [R. Boujbel](https://github.com/rjbou) reducing macOS job overhead by launching solver tests only when `src/solver` is modified and removing legacy upgrade tests ([#6745](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6745))
- **Development branch** bumped to 2.6.0~alpha1~dev by [R. Boujbel](https://github.com/rjbou) following the 2.5.0~alpha1 release ([#6749](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6749))
repositories.discussions_summary: Admin script cleanup, Windows dependency challenges, release process refinements, and repository upgrade policy
repositories.notable_discussions:
- **Admin script cleanup** discussion between [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) and [David Allsopp](https://github.com/dra27) regarding removal of unused scripts while questioning the fate of `opam-admin.top` ([#6750](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6750))
- **Windows dependency challenges** discussed by [Antonin Décimo](https://github.com/MisterDA) and [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) involving FlexDLL version parsing issues and compatibility constraints with different OCaml versions ([#6746](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6746), [#6592](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6592))
- **Release process refinements** discussed during dev meeting regarding reproducible archive generation using makefile subshells versus sh subshells ([#6706](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6706))
- **Repository upgrade policy** conversation about enforcing repository root checks and adding upgrade advice for version 1.2 repositories ([#6391](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6391))
repositories.trends_summary: Release stabilization, platform-specific hardening, testing infrastructure investment, and shell initialization refinement
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **Release stabilization** focus with 2.5.0~alpha1 shipped containing incremental loading optimizations, shell improvements, and accumulated bug fixes from multiple contributors
- **Platform-specific hardening** across Ubuntu/AppArmor, Alpine Linux, and Windows builds addressing real-world deployment issues
- **Testing infrastructure investment** with new reftest commands (`opam-set-os`, `sed-hash`) improving test maintainability and cross-platform testing capabilities
- **Shell initialization refinement** addressing long-standing user configuration issues with Bash profile/rc file handling and environment variable management
repositories.contributors_summary: Five core contributors merged 16 PRs, opened 7 PRs and 7 issues covering release preparation, platform support, and bug fixes
repositories.contributors:
- [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) merged seven PRs covering Alpine Linux hardening ([#6742](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6742)), reproducible releases ([#6706](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6706)), AppArmor support ([#6647](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6647)), Bash configuration improvements ([#6603](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6603)), recompilation fixes ([#6505](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6505)), OPAMFETCH parsing ([#5492](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/5492)), and coordinated the 2.5.0~alpha1 release ([#6744](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6744)), while opening four new PRs for admin script cleanup, installer updates, and Makefile hardening, and reporting four issues about reproducibility and tooling improvements
- [R. Boujbel](https://github.com/rjbou) merged six PRs including version bump to 2.6.0~alpha1~dev ([#6749](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6749)), reftest hash replacement command ([#6734](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6734)), `opam remove --force` fix ([#6672](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6672)), git exit code handling ([#6422](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6422)), repository administration improvements ([#6391](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6391)), and macOS CI optimization ([#6745](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6745)), while opening version bump PR ([#6747](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6747)) and raising repository upgrade policy issue ([#6743](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6743))
- [David Allsopp](https://github.com/dra27) merged environment variable handling improvements preventing redundant shell hook sourcing when `OPAM_SWITCH_PREFIX` is already set ([#6729](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6729)) and participated in admin script cleanup discussions
- [@arozovyk](https://github.com/arozovyk) merged reftest OS configuration command ([#6741](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6741)) and opened PR for stale switch directory cleanup ([#6735](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6735))
- [Antonin Décimo](https://github.com/MisterDA) merged Windows bootstrap dependencies update ([#6592](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6592)) and engaged in technical discussions about FlexDLL version parsing and compatibility issues
- [@nilsbecker](https://github.com/nilsbecker) reported issue regarding old OpenSSL version in dream preventing downstream package installation ([#6736](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6736))
- [@rwmjones](https://github.com/rwmjones) reported and saw resolution of cmdliner compilation error ([#6739](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6739))

repositories.brief_summary: Three new PRs opened for autocompletion, metrics precision, and .merlin fallback behavior improvements
repositories.activity_summary: New PRs for labelled argument autocompletion, metrics precision, and .merlin fallback alongside ongoing MLX formatting work
repositories.activity:
- **Labelled argument autocompletion** opened by [Tom Ekander](https://github.com/lessp) adding `:` as completion trigger and construct-based suggestions for function arguments ([#1564](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1564)), with [Ulysse](https://github.com/voodoos), [Xavier Van de Woestyne](https://github.com/xvw), and [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg) discussing scope of trigger characters, usefulness in large codebases, and potential for configurable behavior
- **Metrics timestamp precision** improved by [Tim ats](https://github.com/Tim-ats-d) switching from `Unix.time` to `Unix.gettimeofday` for sub-second resolution in `view-metrics` duration field ([#1565](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1565)), with [Ulysse](https://github.com/voodoos) providing changelog formatting feedback
- **.merlin fallback behavior** enhanced by [Ulysse](https://github.com/voodoos) for more natural fallback when no dune-project is found ([#1563](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1563)), addressing behavior described in [#1522](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1522)
- **MLX file formatting** support continuing from [David Sancho](https://github.com/davesnx) with ocamlformat-mlx integration for `.mlx` files ([#1528](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1528)), ready for re-review
- **Nix flake dependencies** updated automatically including merlin5_3 and nixpkgs overlays ([#1437](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1437))
- **Stale PRs closed** including draft PR for configurable Merlin cache period ([#1210](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1210)) and type-annotate action fixes ([#1048](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1048))
- **Merlin fork upstreaming** issue closed after completing monadic IO and Spawn integration work ([#1052](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1052))
repositories.discussions_summary: Detailed discussion on labelled argument autocompletion exploring trigger characters and construct query configuration
repositories.notable_discussions:
- **Autocompletion design trade-offs** discussed extensively on [#1564](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1564) with [Ulysse](https://github.com/voodoos) raising concerns about `:` trigger character applicability across syntax, [Tom Ekander](https://github.com/lessp) demonstrating usefulness for variants and records in large codebases with multiple type indirections, and [Xavier Van de Woestyne](https://github.com/xvw) suggesting construct results are overused as hack entry points
- **Construct query control** proposed by [Ulysse](https://github.com/voodoos) suggesting VSCode custom query support with configuration options to enable returning values, allowing users to call construct manually instead of relying on `_` completion hack, addressing concerns about excessive suggestions in completion box without smart sorting
- **Constructor-based completion** experimented with by [Tom Ekander](https://github.com/lessp) showing auto-complete for valid constructors returning specific types with proper syntax insertion like `~color:(Test_re.Color.custom ~r:_ ~g:_ ~b:_)`, extending beyond basic construct suggestions
repositories.trends_summary: Editor experience improvements focusing on completion intelligence and developer workflow enhancements
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **Completion intelligence enhancements** emerging with proposals for labelled argument autocompletion ([#1564](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1564)) and constructor-based suggestions, reflecting focus on reducing friction in large codebases where type definitions are multiple indirections away
- **Configuration flexibility** becoming theme with discussions about making construct query behavior configurable rather than always-on, recognizing that aggressive completion can be detrimental without smart sorting
- **Project maintenance** demonstrated through cleanup of stale draft PRs ([#1210](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1210), [#1048](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1048)) and closing completed issues ([#1052](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1052)), keeping issue tracker focused on active work
repositories.contributors_summary: Tom Ekander, Tim ats, Ulysse, and David Sancho contributed new PRs with extensive design discussions
repositories.contributors:
- [Tom Ekander](https://github.com/lessp) opened labelled argument autocompletion PR ([#1564](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1564)) with detailed examples using variants and records, participated in design discussions about trigger characters and usefulness in large codebases, and demonstrated experimental constructor-based completion approach
- [Tim ats](https://github.com/Tim-ats-d) opened PR improving metrics timestamp precision ([#1565](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1565)) by switching to `Unix.gettimeofday` for sub-second resolution
- [Ulysse](https://github.com/voodoos) opened PR for .merlin fallback improvements ([#1563](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1563)), provided review feedback and changelog guidance on metrics PR ([#1565](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1565)), and contributed extensive analysis on autocompletion design trade-offs including concerns about trigger character scope and suggestions for configurable construct query behavior ([#1564](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1564))
- [David Sancho](https://github.com/davesnx) continued work on MLX file formatting support ([#1528](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1528)) signaling readiness for re-review
- [Xavier Van de Woestyne](https://github.com/xvw) participated in autocompletion design discussion ([#1564](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1564)) noting construct results are often overused as hack entry points
- [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg) was mentioned in autocompletion discussion ([#1564](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1564)) for input on design decisions

repositories.brief_summary: Completion fix for inlined record labels and OCaml 5.4 release support
repositories.new_features_summary: Fixed completion for inlined record labels and updated CI to support OCaml 5.4
repositories.new_features:
- **Completion now works for inlined record labels** in pattern matching contexts, fixing a limitation where label suggestions failed when matching against constructors with inline record syntax like `Constr of { field: int }` ([#1978](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1978))
- **CI workflows updated** to support OCaml 5.4.0 release, replacing trunk compiler references with stable 5.4 version across main, fuzzy-ci, and ocaml-lsp-compat workflows ([65b973de](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/commit/65b973de49adc77997af202831b6414cd4dc48c0), [307ee45a](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/commit/307ee45afe20f07d18ac3d4b143d7dc507b54977))
repositories.activity_summary: New PR fixing inlined record completion opened, two old WIP PRs closed
repositories.activity:
- [Ulysse](https://github.com/voodoos) opened PR fixing **completion for inlined record labels** with special case handling for `Tconstr` with `Pcstr_ty` in target type checking ([#1978](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1978)), implementing the fix through added test case and commits showing debugging process
- [Thomas Refis](https://github.com/trefis) opened issue reporting **completion failure on inlined record fields** where pattern matching against constructors with inline record syntax returned empty completion results ([#1977](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1977))
- [Brian Ward](https://github.com/WardBrian) followed up on **custom operators location improvement** PR from March with comment pinging for review status ([#1917](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1917))
- [@3Rafal](https://github.com/3Rafal) had two old PRs closed: behavior regression CI from 2023 ([#1642](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1642)) and cache granularity WIP from 2023 ([#1696](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1696))
- [Dependabot](https://github.com/dependabot) opened PR bumping **cachix/install-nix-action** from 31.7.0 to 31.8.0 with Nix 2.32.0 update ([#1976](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1976))
repositories.trends_summary: Focus on completion improvements and OCaml 5.4 release support
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **Completion system refinements** addressing edge cases in type-directed completion, particularly for pattern matching contexts with inlined record syntax where environment label folding doesn't capture constructor-specific fields ([#1977](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1977), [#1978](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1978))
- **OCaml 5.4 release adoption** with CI infrastructure updated from trunk/variants to stable release, indicating production readiness for the new compiler version ([307ee45a](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/commit/307ee45afe20f07d18ac3d4b143d7dc507b54977))
- **Project maintenance** activity with cleanup of stale PRs from 2023 that never progressed beyond WIP status ([#1642](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1642), [#1696](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1696))
repositories.contributors_summary: Ulysse implemented completion fix, Thomas Refis reported the bug, Brian Ward followed up on earlier PR
repositories.contributors:
- [Ulysse](https://github.com/voodoos) implemented the **inlined record label completion** fix through multiple commits showing the debugging and implementation process, adding special case handling in `get_candidates` function to detect and lookup labels from inlined record constructors ([#1978](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1978)), and updated CI workflows for OCaml 5.4 support ([307ee45a](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/commit/307ee45afe20f07d18ac3d4b143d7dc507b54977))
- [Thomas Refis](https://github.com/trefis) reported the **completion failure** bug with detailed reproduction steps showing the difference between inlined record and indirect record completion behavior ([#1977](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1977))
- [Brian Ward](https://github.com/WardBrian) engaged in follow-up discussion on **custom operators location** PR from March, requesting review status after several months ([#1917](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1917))
- [Dependabot](https://github.com/dependabot) automated the dependency update for **Nix action** infrastructure ([#1976](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1976))

repositories.brief_summary: Package management search command, concurrent test execution with watch mode, and OxCaml parametric library improvements
repositories.new_features_summary: New `dune pkg search` command for package discovery, concurrent test execution with watch server, and Merlin support for parametric libraries
repositories.new_features:
- **Package search command** `dune pkg search` allows searching through configured repositories by package name using substring or glob patterns ([#12547](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12547))
- **Concurrent test execution** with watch mode server - `dune runtest` can now run while watch mode is active, eliminating the need to stop the server ([#12473](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12473), [#8114](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/8114))
- **OxCaml Merlin configuration** for library parameters - the `-parameter` compiler flag is now properly added to Merlin config files, enabling IDE support for parametric libraries ([#12550](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12550), [#12546](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12546))
- **Dev tools installation** now works without the `LOCK_DEV_TOOL` feature gate - `dune tools install` commands no longer require setting the feature flag ([#12575](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12575), [#12574](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12574))
- **Lock directory validation** - duplicate lock directories and repository definitions are now detected and reported with clear error messages ([#12549](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12549), [#12548](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12548), [#9356](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/9356))
- **Improved variables documentation** - clarified that `ocaml-config:v` uses `ocamlc -config-var` and improved formatting throughout the variables reference ([#12539](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12539))
- **Melange documentation fix** - corrected reference from `subdir` to `dirs` stanza in Melange documentation ([#12596](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12596))
repositories.activity_summary: Code refactoring across stanza definitions, RPC system improvements, and ongoing work on parametric libraries and package management features
repositories.activity:
- **Newly opened PRs** this week include enhanced `dune init` with source path handling by [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg) ([#12601](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12601)), `dune describe tests` subcommand by [Leitao -- Pereira Dias Rodrigue](https://github.com/Gromototo) for listing test metadata ([#12545](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12545)), Dune self-pinning to prevent version compatibility issues ([#12583](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12583), [#12381](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12381)), RPC system refactoring by [Ambre Austen Suhamy](https://github.com/ElectreAAS) ([#12580](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12580)), include_subdirs qualified ambiguity fix ([#12587](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12587)), Nix devShell for OxCaml by [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter) ([#12582](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12582)), and parametric library instantiation by [@art-w](https://github.com/art-w) ([#12561](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12561), [#12088](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12088))
- **Stanza refactoring** work by [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg) including renaming `Stanza_common` to `Stanza_pkg` ([#12593](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12593)), reducing boilerplate in stanza definitions ([#12592](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12592)), removing duplicate code between library and library_parameter stanzas ([#12594](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12594)), simplifying stanza handling ([#12595](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12595)), splitting modules settings ([#12591](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12591)), consolidating include_subdirs checks ([#12590](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12590)), and simplifying loc/ocamllex/ocamlyacc handling ([#12589](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12589))
- **Melange improvements** by [Antonio Nuno Monteiro](https://github.com/anmonteiro) fixing `.cmj` dependency tracking with `include_qualified` ([#12531](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12531)) and refactoring `read_deps_of` function ([#12559](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12559))
- **Code cleanup** removing dead code for unsupported OCaml versions ([#12579](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12579)), unused Path functions ([#12558](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12558)), dead code in dune_project ([#12598](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12598)), and refactoring Merlin flag handling ([#12568](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12568))
- **Bug fixes** including flaky RPC tests by calling ping properly ([#12571](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12571)), fixing `dune install --create-install-files` opam file overwriting by [Antonin Décimo](https://github.com/MisterDA) ([#12542](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12542), [#12540](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12540)), correcting changelog entry location ([#12573](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12573)), fixing project version dependency handling ([#12556](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12556), [#12131](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12131)), OxCaml eta-expansion changes import ([#12563](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12563)), and optimizing single-module buildables to skip transitive ocamldep ([#12555](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12555))
- **Package management** work continuing with ongoing autolocking PR by [Marek Kubica](https://github.com/Leonidas-from-XIV) making lock files build targets ([#11775](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11775), [#12098](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12098))
repositories.discussions_summary: Active discussions on package management design, tooling support for parametric libraries, and build system improvements
repositories.notable_discussions:
- **Package management lock directory placement** - ongoing discussion about whether lock directories should be in `_build` by default versus the worktree, with debate over portability vs. noise concerns ([#12097](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12097))
- **Parametric libraries tooling support** tracking issue covering Merlin, OCaml-LSP, js_of_ocaml, and odoc integration for the new OxCaml feature ([#12536](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12536), [#12564](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12564), [#12565](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12565))
- **One package per directory mode** - long-standing proposal to enforce package isolation per directory, which would help with [#3255](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/3255) and related to overlapping dependencies issue ([#8652](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/8652))
- **Stdout vs stderr output** for informational commands - discussion about making certain `dune` commands print to stdout instead of stderr to improve shell pipeline compatibility ([#12586](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12586), [#316](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/316))
- **Cram test enhancements** including proposals for setup scripts ([#12570](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12570)) and conditional blocks similar to Mercurial's unified tests ([#12566](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12566))
- **Cross-device link error** in `dune pkg lock` when lock files already exist in Docker environments ([#11644](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11644))
- **macOS 10.6.8 build failure** with Dune 3.20.2 related to posix_spawn Exec format error, traced to portable copyfile changes ([#12576](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12576))
repositories.trends_summary: Continued focus on package management maturation, OxCaml parametric libraries integration, and internal code quality improvements
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **Package management feature maturation** with user-facing commands like `dune pkg search` and improved validation, moving toward production readiness
- **OxCaml parametric libraries support** gaining comprehensive tooling integration including Merlin, with active work on library instantiation and Nix development environments
- **Internal architecture cleanup** with extensive refactoring of stanza definitions, RPC system improvements, and removal of legacy code for unsupported OCaml versions
- **Watch mode robustness** improvements enabling concurrent execution of commands that previously required stopping the server
- **Developer experience enhancements** through better error messages for package management, improved documentation, and fixing edge cases in various commands
repositories.issues_summary: Two good first issues available: expect-test corrected file command and Emacs syntax highlighting for parametric library keywords
repositories.good_first_issues:
- **Add dune command for corrected file contents** - implement `dune get-corrected` to fetch the full contents of corrected files from expect-tests, enabling custom diff tools ([#3883](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/3883))
- **Emacs syntax highlighting for parametric libraries** - update the Emacs configuration to add syntax highlighting for new keywords like `parameters`, `library_parameter`, and `implements` introduced with parametric libraries support ([#12567](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12567))

repositories.brief_summary: Discussion continued on tuple projections RFC with focus on row-polymorphic tuples
repositories.activity_summary: Ongoing design discussion on tuple projections RFC focusing on row-polymorphic tuples approach
repositories.activity: - **Tuple projections RFC** ([#57](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/pull/57)) by [Alistair](https://github.com/johnyob) proposes adding labeled and unlabeled tuple projections with syntax like `x.tuple` and `x.3` for accessing tuple elements, with ongoing discussion about row-polymorphic tuples as a potential typing approach
repositories.discussions_summary: Debate on whether row-polymorphic tuples should be separated into their own RFC
repositories.notable_discussions: - [Florian Angeletti](https://github.com/Octachron) suggested that **row-polymorphic tuples** could be explored in a separate RFC ([#57](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/pull/57)), while [Alistair](https://github.com/johnyob) clarified that the current RFC discusses them only as a future compatibility consideration and does not propose implementing them at this time
repositories.contributors_summary: Discussion between Alistair and Florian Angeletti on tuple projections RFC design
repositories.contributors:
- [Alistair](https://github.com/johnyob) authored the tuple projections RFC ([#57](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/pull/57)) and responded to design feedback about the scope of row-polymorphic tuples
- [Florian Angeletti](https://github.com/Octachron) provided feedback on the RFC suggesting row-polymorphic tuples might warrant a separate proposal ([#57](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/pull/57))

repositories.brief_summary: Windows build fixes PR opened addressing Cygwin and MSYS2 compatibility issues
repositories.activity_summary: Windows build compatibility improvements for OCaml 5.0+ on Cygwin and MSYS2 platforms
repositories.activity: - **Windows build fixes** PR opened by [David Allsopp](https://github.com/dra27) addressing OCaml 5.0+ compatibility on Cygwin and MSYS2 environments ([#112](https://github.com/ocaml/ocamlfind/pull/112)). The PR resolves build failures from path separator mishandling in `findlib.conf` generation ([ocaml/opam#6732](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6732)), fixes silent `findlib.conf` misgeneration on mingw-w64/MSVC ([ocaml/opam-repository#28636](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28636)), corrects incorrect META.pkg checking in `ocamlfind install`, and addresses minor legacy issues with `cygpath` flags and Standard Library retrieval. The PR shifts `findlib.conf` generation from build-time to configure-time to simplify path escaping logic
repositories.contributors_summary: David Allsopp contributed Windows platform build fixes
repositories.contributors: - [David Allsopp](https://github.com/dra27) opened comprehensive Windows build fixes PR addressing multiple platform-specific issues for OCaml 5.0+ compatibility on Cygwin and MSYS2 ([#112](https://github.com/ocaml/ocamlfind/pull/112)), with collaboration from [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) on opam integration, [Jan Midtgaard](https://github.com/jmid) on opam-repository issues, and [Marek Kubica](https://github.com/Leonidas-from-XIV) on Dune package management

repositories.brief_summary: Markdown generator reorganized and enhanced with multi-file support
repositories.new_features_summary: Multi-file support added to markdown-generate and html-generate commands
repositories.new_features:
- **Multi-file support** for `markdown-generate` command now accepts multiple `.odocl` files in a single invocation, eliminating the need for shell scripting loops ([#1388](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1388))
- **Multi-file support** extended to `html-generate` command allowing batch generation from multiple `.odocl` files ([#1388](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1388))
- **Command organization** improved by moving `markdown-generate` and `markdown-generate-source` from pipeline section to generators section in CLI, providing better categorization alongside `latex-generate` and `man-generate` ([#1387](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1387))
repositories.activity_summary: Markdown generator improvements merged with CLI enhancements and long-standing issue closure
repositories.activity:
- **Markdown generator organization** improved by [David Sancho](https://github.com/davesnx) reclassifying markdown commands from pipeline to generators section for better CLI structure ([#1387](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1387))
- **Batch generation capability** added through multi-file input support by [David Sancho](https://github.com/davesnx) for both `markdown-generate` and `html-generate` commands, addressing integration needs with [ocaml/dune#12477](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12477) ([#1388](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1388))
- **Long-standing markdown request** closed as [Jon Ludlam](https://github.com/jonludlam) confirmed markdown output capability ([#709](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/709)) has been resolved by the merge of the experimental markdown generator ([#1341](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1341))
- **Hidden attribute PR** closed without merging by [@3Rafal](https://github.com/3Rafal) after remaining open since April 2023, with conflicts preventing merge ([#950](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/950))
repositories.trends_summary: Continued refinement of markdown generation capabilities and improved Dune integration
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **Markdown generator maturation** continues with [David Sancho](https://github.com/davesnx) driving improvements to the experimental markdown generator through CLI enhancements ([#1387](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1387)) and multi-file support ([#1388](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1388))
- **Dune integration** driving odoc development as multi-file support was motivated by markdown integration in [ocaml/dune#12477](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12477), showing collaboration between the two projects
- **CLI consistency** focus evident in reorganizing markdown commands to align with other generators (LaTeX, man pages) rather than treating them as pipeline commands ([#1387](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1387))
repositories.contributors_summary: David Sancho implemented features while Jon Ludlam provided reviews and issue management
repositories.contributors:
- [David Sancho](https://github.com/davesnx) implemented CLI reorganization for markdown commands ([#1387](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1387)) and multi-file support for markdown and HTML generators ([#1388](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1388))
- [Jon Ludlam](https://github.com/jonludlam) reviewed and merged both PRs ([#1387](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1387), [#1388](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1388)), closed the long-standing markdown output issue ([#709](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/709)), and provided the idea for multi-file generation
- [Daniel Bünzli](https://github.com/dbuenzli) participated in issue discussions noting that markdown output was solved by [#1341](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1341)

repositories.brief_summary: Rocq 9.x releases, Sail 0.20 with Rocq semantics, ppxlib 0.37.0, lambdapi 3.0.0, and 20 package updates merged
repositories.new_features_summary: OCaml 5.4 manual updates, Sail Rocq semantics, miou poll/ppoll performance, lambdapi 3.0.0 tactics, security updates
repositories.new_features:

- **base package v0.14.3** checksum verification fix by updating patch source URL to opam-source-archives ([#28718](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/pull/28718))
- **Sail 0.20** released with Rocq semantics implementation - core stepwise semantics now in Rocq, improved C++ backend support across 13 packages by [Alasdair Armstrong](https://github.com/Alasdair) ([#28713](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/pull/28713))
- **Rocq 9.1.0 and 9.0.1** releases by [Guillaume Melquiond](https://github.com/silene) bringing latest Coq fork updates ([#28706](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/pull/28706), [#28707](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/pull/28707))

repositories.trends_summary: Rocq ecosystem growth, OCaml 5.4 preparation, security updates, coordinated multi-package releases, DSL maturity
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **Rocq ecosystem expansion** with releases of 9.0.1 and 9.1.0, related packages like coq-lsp, and Sail integrating Rocq semantics showing growing adoption of the Coq fork
- **OCaml 5.4 preparation** beginning with preview packages, documentation updates including reference manual improvements, and compatibility work
- **Large coordinated releases** such as Sail's 13-package update demonstrating ecosystem maturation and better coordination of multi-package projects
- **Security infrastructure maintenance** with regular updates to ca-certs-nss following Mozilla certificate releases and checksum verification improvements
- **Domain-specific languages** reaching production readiness with Catala 1.0.0~beta for tax code and Sail for processor instruction semantics

repositories.brief_summary: Bug fixes for compiler inlining and improved NaN handling in both JavaScript and WebAssembly runtimes
repositories.new_features_summary: Improved NaN handling ensures consistent behavior across V8 and other JavaScript engines
repositories.new_features:
- **Consistent NaN handling** across JavaScript engines by converting signaling NaNs to quiet NaNs in `caml_int64_bits_of_float` and `caml_int64_float_of_bits` functions, addressing V8's use of signaling NaNs as sentinels ([#2110](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2110))
- Fixed **compiler inlining bug** that caused assertion failures with `Some variables escaped` error in release mode builds ([#2107](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2107))
- **WebAssembly backend cleanup** reducing code complexity with 976 insertions and 887 deletions across the generate.ml module ([#2109](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2109))
- **Magic number version** now obtained from compiler-libs instead of hardcoded values ([c2426e77](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/c2426e77d2650146a1cefcb4e2cc81ea0238f5d2))
- **Bigarray runtime fix** in WebAssembly preventing tail calls to well-known JavaScript primitives to ensure proper inlining ([b896922d](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/b896922d824e8680d04f5da3b2d8741cd366648c))
repositories.activity_summary: Active development on WebAssembly runtime features and OCaml 5.4 compatibility testing
repositories.activity:
- **New PR opened** for JavaScript eval function access in WebAssembly runtime by [Jérôme Vouillon](https://github.com/vouillon), with discussion about ensuring consistent behavior between JS and Wasm backends and handling of extra parentheses for invalid inputs ([#2108](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2108))
- **OCaml 5.4 CI testing** work ongoing by [@hhugo](https://github.com/hhugo), currently blocked on wasm_of_ocaml compatibility and requiring ppx_expect.v0.17.3 with ppxlib.0.37 support ([#2103](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2103))
- **Oxcaml support** draft PR continues development with 11,208 additions across 141 files by [Jérôme Vouillon](https://github.com/vouillon) ([#2105](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2105))
- **WASI runtime** PR remains in progress with 4,835 additions supporting Wizard engine and wasmtime execution with stack-switching and exception handling extensions ([#1831](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1831))
- **Compiler hints** from [ocaml/ocaml#13438](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13438) being integrated in draft PR by [@hhugo](https://github.com/hhugo), though currently in conflicting state ([#1721](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1721))
repositories.discussions_summary: Discussion about WebAssembly runtime consistency with JavaScript backend for eval functionality
repositories.notable_discussions:
- **Eval function behavior** discussed between [@hhugo](https://github.com/hhugo) and [Jérôme Vouillon](https://github.com/vouillon) regarding extra parentheses in WebAssembly runtime versus JavaScript runtime, with concerns about accepting invalid inputs like `"a)(b"` and trade-offs documented in code comments ([#2108](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2108))
- **Testing requirements** emphasized by [@hhugo](https://github.com/hhugo) for WebAssembly eval function to ensure agreement between Wasm and JS runtimes and verify that inlining optimization doesn't change behavior ([#2108](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2108))
repositories.trends_summary: Continued focus on WebAssembly backend improvements and runtime consistency
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **WebAssembly runtime maturity** demonstrated through cleanup work, bigarray fixes, and ongoing WASI runtime development showing commitment to Wasm as first-class compilation target ([#2109](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2109), [#2112](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2112), [#1831](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1831))
- **Cross-backend consistency** emphasized in discussions about eval function and NaN handling, ensuring identical behavior between JavaScript and WebAssembly runtimes ([#2108](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2108), [#2110](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2110))
- **OCaml compiler evolution** tracking shown through compiler-libs integration, OCaml 5.4 testing, and consuming hints from upstream OCaml compiler improvements ([#2111](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2111), [#2103](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2103), [#1721](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1721))
repositories.contributors_summary: Jérôme Vouillon and Hugo Heuzard actively developing features with Nicolás Ojeda Bär providing bug reports and testing
repositories.contributors:
- [Jérôme Vouillon](https://github.com/vouillon) implemented NaN handling improvements ([#2110](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2110)), WebAssembly backend cleanup ([#2109](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2109)), magic number compiler-libs integration ([#2111](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2111)), bigarray runtime fix ([#2112](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2112)), test cleanup ([#2113](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2113)), and opened PR for WebAssembly eval function support ([#2108](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2108))
- [@hhugo](https://github.com/hhugo) fixed compiler inlining bug ([#2107](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2107)), provided code review feedback on NaN handling and eval function PRs ([#2110](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2110), [#2108](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2108)), and continues work on OCaml 5.4 CI integration ([#2103](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2103))
- [Nicolás Ojeda Bär](https://github.com/nojb) reported compiler inlining bug with detailed reproduction information and debug output ([#2106](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2106)) and confirmed the fix resolved the issue ([#2107](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2107))

repositories.brief_summary: Metaprogramming quotation fixes, type system improvements, and compiler debugger enhancements merged this week
repositories.new_features_summary: Quotation API additions, bits8/bits16 kinds without extension, improved debugger location info, and build path loading fix
repositories.new_features:
- New **quotation API functions** `Code.Closed.to_exp` and `Code.Closed.print` added to `CamlinternalQuote` module for converting closed code to expressions and formatted printing ([#4896](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4896))
- **bits8 and bits16 kinds** now allowed without requiring the `small_numbers` extension, improving library integration while maintaining upstream compatibility ([#4898](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4898))
- Improved **location information in pattern matching** for better debugger stepping behavior and source code position reporting ([#4884](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4884))
- Fixed **loading paths from paths file** bug in `load_path.ml` where variable shadowing caused incorrect path resolution for `-I-paths` flag ([#4878](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4878))
- Enhanced **debugger register handling** in `Name_for_debugger` operations with proper register substitution and unknown location handling ([#4880](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4880))
- **Shrink-wrapping testing** now enabled in CI through new option to `regalloc.exe` tool for inserting prologues ([#4892](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4892))
- Fixed **over-expunged toplevel** by removing unboxed types (`Float_u`, `Iarray`, `Int32_u`, `Int64_u`, `Nativeint_u`) not in compatible Stdlib ([#4877](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4877))
- Documentation typo fixes in unboxed types markdown: corrected `int16x2#` to `int16x8#` and grammar improvements ([#4883](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4883))
repositories.activity_summary: Metaprogramming work and Flambda2 optimizations dominate activity with 10 new PRs opened and ongoing work on modes and effects
repositories.activity:
- **New PRs opened** this week include continuation handling improvements by [Aspen Smith](https://github.com/glittershark) ([#4901](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4901)), metaprogramming mdx fixes by [Mark Shinwell](https://github.com/mshinwell) ([#4900](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4900), [#4899](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4899)), Unix local/read annotations by [Vesa Karvonen](https://github.com/polytypic) ([#4830](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4830)), preemption support ([#4881](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4881)), CFG value propagation for floats by [Xavier Clerc](https://github.com/xclerc) ([#4879](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4879)), extended CFG terminator simplification ([#4807](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4807)), and modes work including global/aliased implications by [@dkalinichenko-js](https://github.com/dkalinichenko-js) ([#4889](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4889)), mode variable conversion ([#4792](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4792)), exception crossing improvements ([#4891](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4891)), and external array renaming ([#4890](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4890))
- **Metaprogramming infrastructure** advanced with quotation evaluation fixes merged by [Jack Rickard](https://github.com/Skepfyr) addressing exception handling and primitive addresses ([#4896](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4896)), double-linking prevention for eval support files by [Mark Shinwell](https://github.com/mshinwell) ([#4895](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4895)), and ongoing work on Camlinternaleval dependencies ([#4899](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4899), [#4900](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4900)) after closing superseded work ([#4894](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4894))
- **Flambda2 optimization work** delivered n-way join analysis exposure by [Basile Clément](https://github.com/bclement-ocp) ([#4821](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4821)), datalog Virtual_machine.iterator cleanup ([#4897](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4897)), and reverted static constant sharing due to backtrace issues ([#4893](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4893)) though it was briefly merged ([#4800](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4800))
- **Backend and type system** improvements included CFG terminator simplification revert due to loop information issues by [Xavier Clerc](https://github.com/xclerc) ([#4885](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4885)), private `Reg.t` refactoring in progress by [Greta Yorsh](https://github.com/gretay-js) ([#4888](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4888)), bits8/bits16 kinds compatibility by [Nailen Matschke](https://github.com/nmatschke) ([#4898](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4898)), and path loading fix by [Andrei Odintsov](https://github.com/Forestryks) ([#4878](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4878))
- **Infrastructure and tooling** updates included GDB memsearch utility improvements by [Nick Barnes](https://github.com/NickBarnes) ([#4886](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4886)), const qualifiers for caml_startup functions ([#4882](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4882)), cfg_tool.exe development for debugging CFG issues ([#4596](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4596)), config variables printing work ([#4873](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4873)), toplevel expunging fix by [David Allsopp](https://github.com/dra27) ([#4877](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4877)), and shrink-wrapping CI testing ([#4892](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4892))
- **Ongoing runtime and effects work** includes domain lock unification by [Stephen Dolan](https://github.com/stedolan) ([#4769](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4769)), preemption implementation by [Aspen Smith](https://github.com/glittershark) ([#4881](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4881)), continuation handling improvements ([#4901](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4901)), and GC check skipping for external arrays ([#4622](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4622))
repositories.trends_summary: Focus on metaprogramming stability, type system modes refinement, and compiler debugging infrastructure improvements
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **Metaprogramming maturation** continues with focus on quotation evaluation correctness, mdx integration, and linking infrastructure through multiple PRs addressing edge cases in the evaluation system ([#4896](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4896), [#4895](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4895), [#4899](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4899), [#4900](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4900))
- **Modes system refinement** shows ongoing work on soundness and usability with PRs addressing global/aliased relationships, mode variable serialization, and exception crossing semantics ([#4889](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4889), [#4792](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4792), [#4891](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4891))
- **Debugger and location information** receiving attention with pattern matching location improvements and register handling enhancements for better debugging experience ([#4884](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4884), [#4880](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4880), [#4886](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4886))
- **Backend optimization caution** demonstrated by multiple reverts of optimization PRs when they cause issues with backtraces or loop analysis, showing preference for correctness over performance gains ([#4893](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4893), [#4885](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4885))
- **Effects system development** progressing with continuation handling refactoring and preemption support work alongside domain lock unification for cleaner runtime threading ([#4901](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4901), [#4881](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4881), [#4769](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4769))
- **Upstream compatibility** remains priority with work on allowing erasable features like bits8/bits16 kinds without requiring extensions and fixing toplevel to match compatible Stdlib ([#4898](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4898), [#4877](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4877))
repositories.contributors_summary: 13 contributors active with code contributions from Shinwell, Clément, Clerc, Rickard, and others plus reviews from Kalinichenko, White
repositories.contributors:
- [Mark Shinwell](https://github.com/mshinwell) worked on metaprogramming infrastructure including preventing double-linking of eval support files ([#4895](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4895)), improved debugger location information in pattern matching ([#4884](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4884)), enhanced Name_for_debugger register handling ([#4880](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4880)), and opened PRs for Camlinternaleval mdx fixes ([#4899](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4899), [#4900](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4900))
- [Basile Clément](https://github.com/bclement-ocp) delivered Flambda2 improvements by removing Virtual_machine.iterator ([#4897](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4897)) and exposing join analysis from n-way join ([#4821](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4821))
- [Xavier Clerc](https://github.com/xclerc) merged shrink-wrapping CI testing ([#4892](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4892)), reverted CFG terminator simplification due to loop issues ([#4885](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4885)), and has ongoing work on CFG value propagation ([#4879](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4879), [#4807](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4807)) and cfg_tool.exe ([#4596](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4596))
- [Jack Rickard](https://github.com/Skepfyr) implemented quotation evaluation fixes addressing exception handling and primitive address issues ([#4896](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4896)) with review from [Leo White](https://github.com/lpw25)
- [Nailen Matschke](https://github.com/nmatschke) enabled bits8/bits16 kinds without small_numbers extension for better library integration ([#4898](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4898)) with feedback from [@dkalinichenko-js](https://github.com/dkalinichenko-js)
- [Andrei Odintsov](https://github.com/Forestryks) fixed path loading bug in load_path.ml affecting -I-paths flag ([#4878](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4878))
- [@tkoukpari](https://github.com/tkoukpari) corrected documentation typos in unboxed types markdown ([#4883](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4883))
- [David Allsopp](https://github.com/dra27) fixed over-expunged toplevel by removing unboxed types not in compatible Stdlib ([#4877](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4877))
- [Vincent Laviron](https://github.com/lthls) worked on static constant sharing which was initially merged ([#4800](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4800)) with review from [Mark Shinwell](https://github.com/mshinwell)
- [Greta Yorsh](https://github.com/gretay-js) reverted static constant sharing due to test failures and backtrace issues ([#4893](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4893)) and is working on making Reg.t private ([#4888](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4888)) with extensive review from [Xavier Clerc](https://github.com/xclerc)
- [Nick Barnes](https://github.com/NickBarnes) improved GDB memsearch utility robustness ([#4886](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4886)) and has open work on const qualifiers for caml_startup ([#4882](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4882))
- [Aspen Smith](https://github.com/glittershark) opened PRs for preemption support ([#4881](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4881)) and continuation handling improvements ([#4901](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4901))
- [@dkalinichenko-js](https://github.com/dkalinichenko-js) provided reviews on multiple PRs ([#4896](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4896), [#4898](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4898), [#4884](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4884)) and has ongoing work on modes including global/aliased implications ([#4889](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4889)), exception crossing ([#4891](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4891)), and external arrays ([#4890](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4890), [#4622](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4622))
- [Zesen Qian](https://github.com/riaqn) has ongoing work on mode conversion to constants ([#4792](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4792)) and provided review feedback on global/aliased implications ([#4889](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4889))
- [Vesa Karvonen](https://github.com/polytypic) opened PR for Unix local/read parameter annotations ([#4830](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4830)) under discussion
- [Stephen Dolan](https://github.com/stedolan) has ongoing work on domain lock unification ([#4769](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4769)) with review from [Nick Barnes](https://github.com/NickBarnes)

repositories.brief_summary: Merged OxCaml 5.2.0minus-22 bringing quotation support, layout polymorphism, mode system updates, and new jkind primitives
repositories.new_features_summary: Added quotation/metaprogramming infrastructure, layout polymorphism extension, new jkinds, mode system enhancements, and compiler warnings
repositories.new_features:
- **Quotation and metaprogramming support** via new CamlinternalQuote module (2,805 lines) providing infrastructure for compile-time code generation with variable binding, staging, and AST manipulation facilities ([#191](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/191))
- **Layout polymorphism language extension** (`Layout_poly`) with maturity levels (alpha, beta, stable) allowing types to be polymorphic over memory representations ([#191](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/191))
- **New jkind primitives** including `immediate64_or_null` for nullable immediate64 values and `kind_of_idx` for block indices with mode crossing support ([#191](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/191))
- **Stage tracking in environment** with new `stage` type and operations `enter_quotation`, `enter_splice`, and `check_no_open_quotations` for managing multi-stage compilation contexts ([#191](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/191))
- **Quotation-aware module system** with `require_global_for_quote` and `quoted_globals` functions to track compilation unit dependencies across staging boundaries ([#191](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/191))
- **Enhanced mode system** with refined closure lock mechanism accepting pinpoint descriptions and improved error reporting for mode violations in quotations ([#191](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/191))
- **New compiler warning 215** (`Implied_attribute`) detecting when attributes are redundant because they're implied by other attributes ([#191](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/191))
- **Updated import script** now targets oxcaml/oxcaml repository instead of ocaml-flambda/flambda-backend, reflecting project rename ([#191](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/191))
- **Upstream synchronization** to OxCaml revision 05b98d54a75966bf39540157c8bd1f7281a39e57 incorporating latest compiler developments ([#191](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/191))
repositories.activity_summary: Claude-assisted merge of OxCaml 5.2.0minus-22 with conflict resolution and compilation fixes
repositories.activity:
- [Mark Shinwell](https://github.com/mshinwell) merged OxCaml 5.2.0minus-22 with automated conflict resolution and compilation error fixing using Claude, bringing 168 changed files with 32,413 insertions and 24,515 deletions ([#191](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/191))
- **Parser and syntax** updates with extensive regeneration of parser files affecting 33,963+ lines in parser_raw.ml and 11,515+ lines in parser_recover.ml to support new language features ([#191](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/191))
- **Type system infrastructure** changes across ctype, typecore, typedecl, typemod, and typetexp modules totaling hundreds of lines to support staging and layout polymorphism ([#191](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/191))
- **Mode system overhaul** with 1,165+ line changes in mode.ml affecting uniqueness analysis, solver, and type mode inference ([#191](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/191))
- **Test updates** for function recovery, mode recovery, typer cache stamps, type enclosing, typing recovery, and version tests to reflect new compiler behavior ([#191](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/191))
- [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) provided thorough code review with feedback on conflict resolution choices, suggesting use of `/* BEGIN AVOID */` and `/* END AVOID */` comments, verifying correctness of parser changes, and recommending commenting out rather than deleting code for easier future merges ([#191](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/191))
repositories.trends_summary: Integration work focused on bringing advanced OxCaml features into Merlin with emphasis on metaprogramming capabilities
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **Metaprogramming as core feature** with substantial investment in quotation infrastructure indicating focus on compile-time code generation and staged compilation
- **Language extensibility** through maturity-tracked extensions allowing gradual rollout of experimental features (alpha/beta/stable levels)
- **Mode-aware type system** continuing evolution with refined tracking of uniqueness, locality, and sharing constraints across compilation stages
- **Automated merge tooling** with explicit acknowledgment of AI-assisted conflict resolution and compilation fixes as part of the development workflow
- **Repository transition** from flambda-backend to oxcaml branding reflecting project evolution and independent identity
repositories.contributors_summary: Mark Shinwell performed the merge with Liam Stevenson providing code review
repositories.contributors:
- [Mark Shinwell](https://github.com/mshinwell) executed the merge of OxCaml 5.2.0minus-22, utilized Claude for automated conflict resolution and compilation error fixing, imported the CamlinternalQuote module, and updated the import script to reference oxcaml/oxcaml repository ([#191](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/191))
- [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) conducted code review providing detailed feedback on conflict resolution decisions, parser changes, and merge strategies, suggesting improvements for maintainability and verifying correctness of changes ([#191](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/191))

repositories.brief_summary: Two new PRs opened addressing js_of_ocaml patches and build issues
repositories.activity_summary: Two PRs opened to fix js_of_ocaml patches and iarray compatibility issues
repositories.activity:

- [Patrick Ferris](https://github.com/patricoferris) opened PR to repatch js_of_ocaml iarray handling ([#19](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/19)), investigating potential commit mismatch in js_of_ocaml dependency similar to issue [#11](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/11)
repositories.trends_summary: Ongoing maintenance work addressing patch stability issues in js_of_ocaml integration
repositories.emerging_trends:

- Build system maintenance focusing on **compatibility patches** for JavaScript backend tooling, with attention to ppx_optcomp syntax handling and iarray implementations
